Key Match Events: Shubman Gill scored a 49-ball 66 opening the batting
Ruturaj Gaikwad played the disruptor at No. 4 with a 28-ball 49
Washington Sundar picked up three wickets for 15 runs
Pre-Game Insights: Abhishek Sharma and Gaikwad had to play out of positions at Nos. 3 and 4 due to the return of three players from the T20 World Cup-winning squad
Post-Match Reflections: India took a big step towards winning the five-match T20I series against Zimbabwe with a 23-run win in the third match to take a 2-1 lead
Miscellaneous Highlights: India ended on 182, not below par at all. Two half-century partnerships - 67 off 50 between Gill and Jaiswal and 72 off 44 between Gill and Gaikwad - had taken India there
Others: Zimbabwe's loss of their way, and find it again too late was due to India's decision to accommodate all of their T20 World Cup returnees leaving them thin on bowling resources
